solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (_{j}_ \times _{k}_ + _{k}_ \times _{l}_ + _{j}_ \times _{l}_) = _{{2*((j*k)+(k*l)+(j*l))}}_ cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for _{m}_ boxes \(= _{{2*((j*k)+(k*l)+(j*l))}}_ \times _{m}_\)
\(= _{{2*((j*k)+(k*l)+(j*l))*m}}_ cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(_{j}_ cm \times _{k}_ cm \times _{l}_ cm.\) What is the area, in square centimetres, of a sheet of tin required to make _{m}_ such tins?
